tests.name: cat-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string cat - basic concatenation
puts [string cat]
puts [string cat "hello"]
puts [string cat "hello" " " "world"]
puts [string cat "a" "b" "c" "d"]

tests.name: compare-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string compare - basic comparison
puts [string compare "abc" "abc"]
puts [string compare "abc" "abd"]
puts [string compare "abd" "abc"]
puts [string compare "" ""]
puts [string compare "a" ""]
puts [string compare "" "a"]

tests.name: compare-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string compare - with -nocase
puts [string compare -nocase "ABC" "abc"]
puts [string compare -nocase "abc" "ABC"]
puts [string compare -nocase "Hello" "HELLO"]
puts [string compare -nocase "Hello" "World"]

tests.name: compare-1.2
tests.script:
# Test: string compare - with -length
puts [string compare -length 3 "hello" "helloworld"]
puts [string compare -length 3 "abc" "abd"]
puts [string compare -length 0 "abc" "xyz"]
puts [string compare -length 10 "abc" "abc"]

tests.name: equal-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string equal - basic equality
puts [string equal "abc" "abc"]
puts [string equal "abc" "abd"]
puts [string equal "" ""]
puts [string equal "hello" "hello"]
puts [string equal "Hello" "hello"]

tests.name: equal-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string equal - with -nocase
puts [string equal -nocase "ABC" "abc"]
puts [string equal -nocase "Hello" "HELLO"]
puts [string equal -nocase "hello" "world"]

tests.name: equal-1.2
tests.script:
# Test: string equal - with -length
puts [string equal -length 3 "hello" "helloworld"]
puts [string equal -length 3 "abc" "abd"]
puts [string equal -length 5 "hello" "hello world"]

tests.name: error-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string command errors
catch {string} msg
puts $msg
catch {string unknown} msg
puts $msg
catch {string length} msg
puts $msg
tests.stdout:
wrong # args: should be "string subcommand ?arg ...?"
unknown or ambiguous subcommand "unknown": must be cat, compare, equal, first, index, insert, is, last, length, map, match, range, repeat, replace, reverse, tolower, totitle, toupper, trim, trimleft, trimright, wordend, or wordstart
wrong # args: should be "string length string"

tests.name: first-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string first - basic search
puts [string first "l" "hello"]
puts [string first "ll" "hello"]
puts [string first "x" "hello"]
puts [string first "" "hello"]
puts [string first "hello" "hello"]

tests.name: first-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string first - with startIndex
puts [string first "a" "abracadabra" 0]
puts [string first "a" "abracadabra" 1]
puts [string first "a" "abracadabra" 5]
puts [string first "a" "0a23456789abcdef" 5]

tests.name: index-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string index - basic usage
puts [string index "hello" 0]
puts [string index "hello" 1]
puts [string index "hello" 4]
puts [string index "hello" 5]
puts [string index "hello" -1]

tests.name: index-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string index - end-relative indices
puts [string index "hello" end]
puts [string index "hello" end-1]
puts [string index "hello" end-4]
puts [string index "hello" end-5]

tests.name: insert-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string insert - basic usage
puts [string insert "hello" 0 "X"]
puts [string insert "hello" 2 "X"]
puts [string insert "hello" end "X"]
puts [string insert "hello" 5 "X"]

tests.name: insert-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string insert - edge cases
puts [string insert "" 0 "hello"]
puts [string insert "hello" -1 "X"]
puts [string insert "hello" 100 "X"]
puts [string insert "abc" end-1 "X"]

tests.name: is-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string is - integer class
puts [string is integer 123]
puts [string is integer -456]
puts [string is integer "abc"]
puts [string is integer ""]
puts [string is integer -strict ""]

tests.name: is-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string is - alpha and alnum classes
puts [string is alpha "hello"]
puts [string is alpha "hello123"]
puts [string is alpha ""]
puts [string is alnum "hello123"]
puts [string is alnum "hello!"]

tests.name: is-1.2
tests.script:
# Test: string is - boolean and digit classes
puts [string is boolean true]
puts [string is boolean false]
puts [string is boolean 1]
puts [string is boolean 0]
puts [string is boolean "maybe"]
puts [string is digit "12345"]
puts [string is digit "12a45"]

tests.name: is-1.3
tests.script:
# Test: string is - double and space classes
puts [string is double "3.14"]
puts [string is double "1e10"]
puts [string is double "abc"]
puts [string is space "   "]
puts [string is space "\t\n"]
puts [string is space "hello"]

tests.name: is-1.4
tests.script:
# Test: string is - upper and lower classes
puts [string is upper "HELLO"]
puts [string is upper "Hello"]
puts [string is upper ""]
puts [string is lower "hello"]
puts [string is lower "Hello"]
puts [string is lower ""]

tests.name: is-1.5
tests.script:
# Test: string is - list class
puts [string is list {a b c}]
puts [string is list "a b c"]
puts [string is list "not a {proper list"]

tests.name: is-1.6
tests.script:
# Test: string is - xdigit class
puts [string is xdigit "0123456789"]
puts [string is xdigit "abcdefABCDEF"]
puts [string is xdigit "xyz"]
puts [string is xdigit "12ab"]

tests.name: last-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string last - basic search
puts [string last "l" "hello"]
puts [string last "ll" "hello"]
puts [string last "x" "hello"]
puts [string last "a" "abracadabra"]

tests.name: last-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string last - with lastIndex
puts [string last "a" "0a23456789abcdef" 15]
puts [string last "a" "0a23456789abcdef" 9]
puts [string last "a" "abracadabra" 5]

tests.name: length-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string length - basic usage
puts [string length "hello"]
puts [string length ""]
puts [string length "hello world"]

tests.name: length-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string length - special characters
puts [string length "a b c"]
puts [string length "tab\there"]
puts [string length "new\nline"]

tests.name: map-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string map - basic usage
puts [string map {a A} "abracadabra"]
puts [string map {a A e E} "abracadabra"]
puts [string map {abc 1 ab 2 a 3 1 0} "1abcaababcababaabbc"]

tests.name: map-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string map - with -nocase
puts [string map -nocase {abc XYZ} "ABCdef"]
puts [string map -nocase {a X} "AaAa"]

tests.name: match-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string match - basic patterns
puts [string match "hello" "hello"]
puts [string match "hello" "world"]
puts [string match "*" "anything"]
puts [string match "h*" "hello"]
puts [string match "*o" "hello"]

tests.name: match-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string match - with ? and []
puts [string match "h?llo" "hello"]
puts [string match "h?llo" "hallo"]
puts [string match "h?llo" "hllo"]
puts [string match {[abc]} "a"]
puts [string match {[abc]} "d"]
puts [string match {[a-z]} "m"]

tests.name: match-1.2
tests.script:
# Test: string match - with -nocase
puts [string match -nocase "HELLO" "hello"]
puts [string match -nocase "h*" "HELLO"]
puts [string match -nocase "*WORLD*" "hello world"]

tests.name: range-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string range - basic usage
puts [string range "hello" 0 4]
puts [string range "hello" 1 3]
puts [string range "hello" 0 0]
puts [string range "hello" 2 end]

tests.name: range-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string range - edge cases
puts [string range "hello" 0 100]
puts [string range "hello" -5 2]
puts [string range "hello" 3 1]
puts [string range "hello" end-2 end]

tests.name: repeat-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string repeat - basic usage
puts [string repeat "ab" 3]
puts [string repeat "x" 5]
puts [string repeat "hello" 0]
puts [string repeat "" 10]

tests.name: replace-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string replace - basic usage
puts [string replace "hello" 1 3]
puts [string replace "hello" 1 3 "XYZ"]
puts [string replace "hello" 0 0 "H"]
puts [string replace "hello" 0 4 "goodbye"]

tests.name: replace-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string replace - edge cases
puts [string replace "hello" 3 1]
puts [string replace "hello" 10 15 "x"]
puts [string replace "hello" -5 0 "X"]
puts [string replace "hello" end end "O"]

tests.name: reverse-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string reverse - basic usage
puts [string reverse "hello"]
puts [string reverse ""]
puts [string reverse "a"]
puts [string reverse "abcdef"]
puts [string reverse "12345"]

tests.name: tolower-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string tolower - basic usage
puts [string tolower "HELLO"]
puts [string tolower "hello"]
puts [string tolower "Hello World"]
puts [string tolower ""]

tests.name: tolower-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string tolower - with first/last indices
puts [string tolower "HELLO WORLD" 0 4]
puts [string tolower "HELLO WORLD" 6 10]
puts [string tolower "HELLO" 2 3]

tests.name: totitle-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string totitle - basic usage
puts [string totitle "hello"]
puts [string totitle "HELLO"]
puts [string totitle "hELLO wORLD"]
puts [string totitle ""]

tests.name: toupper-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string toupper - basic usage
puts [string toupper "hello"]
puts [string toupper "HELLO"]
puts [string toupper "Hello World"]
puts [string toupper ""]

tests.name: toupper-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string toupper - with first/last indices
puts [string toupper "hello world" 0 4]
puts [string toupper "hello world" 6 10]
puts [string toupper "hello" 2 3]

tests.name: trim-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string trim - basic usage
puts [string trim "  hello  "]
puts [string trim "hello"]
puts [string trim "   "]
puts [string trim ""]
puts [string trim "\t\nhello\t\n"]

tests.name: trim-1.1
tests.script:
# Test: string trim - with custom chars
puts [string trim "xxxhelloxxx" "x"]
puts [string trim "abchelloabc" "abc"]
puts [string trim "...hello..." "."]

tests.name: trimleft-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string trimleft - basic usage
puts [string trimleft "  hello  "]
puts [string trimleft "hello"]
puts [string trimleft "xxxhello" "x"]
puts [string trimleft "\t\nhello"]

tests.name: trimright-1.0
tests.script:
# Test: string trimright - basic usage
puts [string trimright "  hello  "]
puts [string trimright "hello"]
puts [string trimright "helloxxx" "x"]
puts [string trimright "hello\t\n"]
